section.section: Retirement shall occur in accordance with the State Personnel and Pensions Article.
Except for the Secretary, retirement is mandatory as provided in § 24-401(c) of the State Personnel and Pensions Article.
The Secretary may apply for disability retirement on behalf of a police employee in accordance with § 29-103 of the State Personnel and Pensions Article.
This subsection does not prevent a police employee from exercising the individual's rights under § 21-111 of the State Personnel and Pensions Article.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a police employee, on retirement in good standing, may keep or acquire the handgun issued by the State to that police employee if:
the police employee reimburses the Department for the replacement value of the handgun; and
the Secretary authorizes the transaction.
The Secretary shall adopt regulations necessary to carry out this subsection.
